questions.text: A 22-year-old woman comes to the emergency department due to intermittent fevers and chills over the past few days. Last week, she underwent routine dental cleaning. The patient has a history of mitral valve prolapse. Temperature is 38.2 C (100.8 F). Physical examination reveals a non-ejection mid-systolic click followed by a late-systolic murmur best heard at the cardiac apex. Blood cultures are drawn and grow gram-positive bacteria that synthesize dextrans from sucrose. Which of the following is the likely cause?

Identify the correct statement: Type I collagen is seen in bone and elastic cartilage Reticular fibres are present in lymph nodes, bone marrow and thymus Right-left movement is by atlanto-axial joint Tibialis anterior has parallel oriented fibres
Which of the following statements is true regarding antigenic drift?

options.label: A
options.text: There is a gradual sequential change in antigenic structure

options.label: B
options.text: It doesn't account for the periodic epidemics of influenza

options.label: C
options.text: The new antigens thus formed are totally unrelated to the previous antigens

options.label: D
options.text: Antigens to the predecessor viruses do not neutralize the new variants

questions.correct_answer: A. There is a gradual sequential change in antigenic structure
questions.explanation: Ans. A. There is a gradual sequential change in antigenic structure

questions.text: Which among the following methods is used to sterilize a glass petri dish?

options.label: A
options.text: Autoclaving at 121 degrees Celsius for 30 - 60 minutes

options.label: B
options.text: Hot air oven at 160 degrees Celsius for 120 minutes or less

options.label: C
options.text: Flash autoclaving at 134 degrees Celsius for 3 minutes

options.label: D
options.text: Hot air oven at 121 degrees Celsius for 30 - 60 minutes

questions.correct_answer: B. Hot air oven at 160 degrees Celsius for 120 minutes or less
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Hot air oven at 160 degrees Celsius for 120 minutes or less

questions.text: Identify the nerve root of the thickened nerve marked in the arrow in the image shown below:
After overhead weight-lifting exercises, a patient developed the following deformity. Which specific muscle or muscle group is likely to be involved in causing this deformity?
Which of the following structures is related to 6th pharyngeal arch?
Identify the incorrect pair:

A 6-year-old, previously healthy girl is brought to the OPD due to diarrhea and abdominal pain. The patient started having watery diarrhea after going out to BBQ Nation for a meal with family; her stools became grossly bloody 2 days later. Her mother also had similar symptoms. Temperature is 37 C (98.6 F). The abdomen is soft with mild, generalized tenderness. Stool culture performed on sorbitol-MacConkey agar shows sorbitol-negative colonies. Which of the following bacteria produces a toxin that is most like the one detected in this patient?
Which of the following statements regarding the marked structure is accurate?

options.label: A
options.text: It is example of pressure epiphysis.

options.label: B
options.text: It gives attachment to long head of humerus and coracobrachialis.

options.label: C
options.text: It is palpable in delto-pectoral groove.

options.label: D
options.text: Gives insertion to pectoralis major muscle

questions.correct_answer: C. It is palpable in delto-pectoral groove.
questions.explanation: Ans. C. It is palpable in delto-pectoral groove.

questions.text: A 42-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a skin rash on his left lower extremity. A month ago, the patient noticed several purple spots on his left calf that have progressively enlarged but are not painful or pruritic. HIV testing is positive, CD4 count is 45/mm³, and HIV viral load is45,000 copies/mL. In addition to antiretroviral therapy and treatment of the skin lesions, which of the following is recommended for this patient?

A 19-year-old man comes to the physician due to diarrhea for the last 4 months. He visited a student health clinic at his university a month ago and was prescribed a course of antibiotics, but his diarrhea failed to improve. He also has persistent nausea, a bloating sensation, and a 6.8-kg weight loss. Microscopic examination of his stool is shown in the image. Impairment of which of the following immune functions would most likely predispose to this patient's infection?

A 30-year-old male presents with sensory loss and weakness of limbs for 3 months. He also has angular stomatitis. On examination, there is loss of proprioception, vibration sensations, UMN type of lower limb weakness, and absent ankle reflex. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Subacute combined degeneration of cord
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Subacute combined degeneration of cord

questions.text: 42-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a week of fever, sore throat, malaise, headache, and skin rash. The rash began on his trunk a week ago and has now spread to his entire body. He has had no chest pain, shortness of breath, diarrhea, or urethral discharge. He has had 3 new female sexual partners over the last year. He drinks alcohol occasionally but does not smoke or use illicit drugs. Examination shows a full-body maculopapular rash without evidence of excoriations. Several raised, grey mucosal patches are seen in the mouth. Cervical, axillary, inguinal, and epitrochlear lymphadenopathy is present. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's current symptoms?
Identify the correct options with indicated structures?

options.label: A
options.text: A-anterior cerebral artery, B-ICA, C-infundibulum, D-Posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F-IV nerve

options.label: B
options.text: A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F- IV nerve

options.label: C
options.text: A-anterior cerebral artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-IV nerve, F- V nerve

options.label: D
options.text: A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F- V nerve

questions.correct_answer: B. A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F- IV nerve
questions.explanation: Ans. B) A-anterior communicating artery, B-ICA, C-Infundibulum, D-posterior communicating artery, E-III nerve, F- IV nerve

questions.text: Match the following:
Loss of sensation to root of penis could be a result of injury to which of the following nerve?
All of the following structures lie in the relation to the left ureter except:

56-year-old woman comes to the emergency department due to a week of fever, dyspnea, and cough with productive, foul-smelling sputum. She underwent an upper gastrointestinal endoscopy 10 days ago for a long history of heartburn. Temperature is 38.7 C (101.7 F), blood pressure is 130/80 mm Hg, pulse is 108/min, and respirations are 22/min. Dentition is poor. Crackles are heard over the right upper lung field. Complete blood count shows leukocytes of 14,500/mm'. Chest x-ray is shown below. Which of the following additional therapies would be most helpful for this patient's condition?

A 42-year-old male present to the OPD complaining of chronic neck pain and stiffness. The pain is localized on the back and side of the neck and sometimes radiates to the shoulder. Pain is particularly exacerbated by rotating the head to the opposite side and tilting it downwards. Marked muscles is most likely involved in this patient's condition. What is the nerve supply of this muscle?

options.label: C
options.text: From the dorsal rami of C1

questions.text: A technician wants to sterilize the material of the laboratory. Which of the following is a correct combination for him to use?
questions.correct_answer: A. Liquid paraffin- Hot air oven

questions.text: A hospital wants to estimate the prevalence of diabetic nephropathy. Kidney biopsy samples are obtained from 500 adult patients with diabetes who receive care at the hospital. The samples are then interpreted by 10 different pathologists, 5 of whom work at the hospital and 5 of whom work at nearby institutions. A preliminary analysis shows that the pathologists who work for the hospital are 3 times more likely to interpret the biopsy samples as diabetic nephropathy compared to those who do not work for the hospital. Which of the following most likely explains this difference in interpretation?
Which of the following muscle groups is primarily assessed with this test to check for motor function in the hand?

A 38-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to fatty food intolerance. On examination, her vital signs are normal, and she has mild right upper quadrant abdominal tenderness. An ultrasonogram of the abdomen reveals multiple gallstones with no evidence of cholecystitis and an ill-defined intrahepatic cyst with a thick wall. A CT of the abdomen is performed and is shown below. What is the most likely etiology for the intrahepatic cyst in this patient?
All of the following are true about the artery marked in the image except:

options.label: B
options.text: It arises from the anterior aortic sinus

options.label: C
options.text: It gives rise to circumflex coronary branch

options.label: D
options.text: Right conus artery is its first branch

questions.correct_answer: C. It gives rise to circumflex coronary branch
questions.explanation: Ans. C. It gives rise to circumflex coronary branch

questions.text: Identify the true statements: IVC passes through the central tendon of diaphragm Left superior intercostal vein drains into the azygos vein There are two dorsal interossei at the middle finger Superficial anterior compartment of leg has no neurovascular bundle
Which of the following terms best describes the MacConkey medium? Differential Enrichment Transport Selective

25-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a painless ulcer on his penis. He is unwilling to disclose sexual history. Physical examination shows a shallow, nontender, and nonexudative penile ulcer with a smooth base. Mild bilateral inguinal lymphadenopathy is present. Serum rapid plasma reagin is positive, and HIV testing is negative. The patient previously required hospitalization in the intensive care unit for a severe rash and oropharyngeal swelling after taking penicillin for a sore throat. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for this patient?
Identify the synovial joints Costotransverse joint Costovertebral joint Costo-chondral joints 2 nd Sternocostal joint Sternoclavicular joint

Identify the false statements: Rickettsial morula in a monocyte is diagnostic of Ehrlichia chaffeensis E6, E7 are targets of vaccine against HPV SARS CO-2 specimen handling for molecular testing needs BSL-2 Raynold-Braude phenomenon is seen in C. albicans

A 65-year-old male presents with sepsis and purpura fulminans. Thromboelastography (TEG) is ordered to assess the patient's clotting profile. Which of the following TEG tracings is most consistent with the patient's presentation?

options.label: A
options.text: Reduced R-time, increased angle, increased MA, increased LY30

options.label: B
options.text: Prolonged R-time, decreased angle, decreased MA, decreased LY30

options.label: C
options.text: Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30

options.label: D
options.text: Reduced R-time, decreased angle, increased MA, decreased LY30

questions.correct_answer: C. Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Prolonged R-time, increased angle, decreased MA, increased LY30.

questions.text: What is the mechanism of action of the toxin produced by the bacterium whose biochemical tests are shown in the figure below?

A 27-year-old woman comes to the OPDdue to joint pain. Her symptoms began 10 days ago and consist of bilateral pain in the metacarpophalangeal joints, proximal interphalangeal joints, wrists, knees, and ankles. She describes joint stiffness lasting 10-15 minutes on awakening in the morning. The patient has also had associated fatigue and a few episodes of loose bowel movements associated with mild skin itching and patchy redness. She has no fever, weight loss, or lymphadenopathy. She works as an elementary school teacher. On examination, there is tenderness of the involved joints without swelling or redness. Which of the following is most likely elevated in this patient?
Which among the following is incorrect regarding Sibsons's fascia?

options.label: A
options.text: Attached to the inner border of 2nd rib

questions.correct_answer: A. Attached to the inner border of 2nd rib
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Attached to the inner border of 2nd rib

questions.text: Identify the correct statements: Thelarche is the first sign of puberty in females. Maximum growth occurs in Tanner stages 4 and 5 in males Penile enlargement is the first sign of puberty in males Peak growth velocity always precedes menarche in females
Identify the structure that represents all 3 types of white matter?
The anesthetist feels a snap while performing an epidural catheter insertion. All of the layers are punctured except:

A 46-year-old man is brought to the emergency department due to a generalized tonic-clonic seizure. He is an agricultural scientist and recently spent 3 months with rural pig farmers. Temperature is 36.8 C (98.2 F), blood pressure is 120/70 mm Hg, and pulse is 86/min. Electroencephalogram shows epileptiform activity. MRI of the brain is shown. A rapid HIV test is negative. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's current condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Abnormal protein in an infected animal brain

options.label: C
options.text: Neurotropic virus acquired from an infected animal bite

options.label: D
options.text: Parasite eggs in contaminated food or water

questions.correct_answer: D. Parasite eggs in contaminated food or water
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Parasite eggs in contaminated food or water

questions.text: A 40-year-old male patients presents with hemiplegia on right side of body. On examination he was having loss of proprioception, fine touch and vibration sensations on right side. He was also unable to recognize the objects with closed eyes from right hand. On examination left side of the tongue was atrophied and deviation on left side during protrusion was found. What is the likely diagnosis?

Identify the correct statements Tectorial membrane is the superior continuation of PLL Common carotid artery divides at the level of lower border of thyroid cartilage Dermis has dense irregular connective tissue Hyaline cartilage has perichondrium with 2-4 chondrocytes in each lacuna

Identify the correct statements with respect to the deficits in different brain regions: Lateral geniculate body-Keyhole shaped defect Substantia nigra-Paralysis agitans Putamen-Athetosis Hypothalamus-Hemiballismus

Identify the correct statements: Normal prostate volume is 20cc. The neurovascular bundle is located between the internal intercostal muscle and innermost intercostal muscle. The neurovascular bundle is arranged in the order of vein-artery-nerve (VAN), from top to bottom. Anterior circumflex humoral artery is a branch of 3 rd part of axillary artery.

A 19-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a week of persistent dry cough that disturbs his sleep. He has also had a sore throat, headaches, and fatigue. Yesterday, he noticed a rash on his arms and legs. Temperature is 37.8 C (100 F), blood pressure is 115/78 mm Hg, pulse is 86/min, and respirations are 16/min. Mild pharyngeal erythema is present. There is no cervical lymphadenopathy. A faint macular rash is present on the extremities. Chest x-ray reveals increased interstitial markings and a small right-sided pleural effusion. Which of the following organisms is most likely causing this patient's condition?

Following surgery for varicose veins, the patient is experiencing a complaint of sensory loss in the lateral area of the leg and foot. Which of the following nerves is the most probable site of injury?
The following manouever is performed at which corresponding vertebral level:

A seventeen-year-old patient is brought to the emergency department having just ingested a large overdose of an antihistaminic drug. This drug is a weak base capable of entering most tissues including the brain. Which of the following statements is true:

options.label: A
options.text: Urinary excretion would be accelerated by administration of NaHCO3, an alkalinizing agent.

options.label: B
options.text: Urinary excretion would be accelerated by the administration of NH4Cl, an acidifying agent.

options.label: C
options.text: More of the drug would be ionized at blood pH than at stomach pH.

options.label: D
options.text: Absorption of the drug would be faster from the stomach than from the small intestine.

questions.correct_answer: B. Urinary excretion would be accelerated by the administration of NH4Cl, an acidifying agent.
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Urinary excretion would be accelerated by administration of NH4Cl, an acidifying agent.

questions.text: A 35-year-old man comes to the emergency department after stepping on a nail that punctured his right sole while jogging at a park. He brought the nail, which is about 4 cm long and rusty, with him. He received a 3-dose primary tetanus vaccination series in childhood but has not received any booster doses since then. Physical examination shows a puncture wound at the middle of the right plantar area with some dry blood and tenderness. Radiographs of the right foot reveal no bony injury or foreign body. The wound is cleaned with iodine solution. Which of the following additional interventions for tetanus prevention is most appropriate in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Tetanus immune globulin and tetanus toxoid vaccine

questions.correct_answer: D. Tetanus immune globulin and tetanus toxoid vaccine
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Tetanus immune globulin and tetanus toxoid vaccine

questions.text: Identify the muscle which is affected in locked jaw:

A 46-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to a week of fever, chills, productive cough with yellow-white sputum, and shortness of breath . The patient received an allogenic renal transplantation 6 months ago and currently takes maintenance immunosuppressive therapy. Chest imaging is shown below. Sputum Gram stain and culture are negative. Bronchoalveolar lavage cultures yield light growth of branching, filamentous rods that are partially acid-fast. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism of this patient's condition?
The test shown below, which uses a bacitracin disk, is useful in identifying?
Identify the liver segment star marked in the image below:

A 24-year-old man comes to the urgent care clinic with a penile lesion that appeared a week ago as a painful papule and has since changed and worsened. Genital examination reveals a tender, 1.5-cm ulcer on the prepuce with well-demarcated, undermined borders and a purulent exudate. Two smaller ulcers with a similar appearance are near the larger ulcer. He has no penile discharge and the scrotum appears normal. Several inguinal lymph nodes are enlarged and tender. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's penile ulcer?
All the following structures are derived from the aponeurosis of the external oblique muscle except:

Which of the following statements are true about the internal capsule? Charcot's artery supplies the posterior limb. Retrolenticular part of the internal capsule contains optic radiation. Anterior limb of the capsule contains corticospinal tract fibers of the upper limb and face. Internal capsule has projection fibers

A 25-year-old man comes to the emergency department in the afternoon due to the sudden onset of abdominal cramps, nausea, and 6 or 7 episodes of vomiting over the past 3 hours. He has had no diarrhea or fever. Yesterday, the patient went on a day-long hike in a nearby forest and had dinner at a Chinese restaurant with friends. Today, he reheated some of the leftover noodles and rice for lunch. None of his friends developed similar symptoms Temperature is 37.1 C (98.8 F), blood pressure is 110/80 mm Hg, and pulse is 90/min. The abdomen is soft and nontender with no organomegaly. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's current condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Bacterial invasion of the intestinal mucosa

options.label: B
options.text: Ingestion of preformed enterotoxin in the food

options.label: C
options.text: Intestinal bacterial colonization and toxin production

questions.correct_answer: B. Ingestion of preformed enterotoxin in the food
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Ingestion of preformed enterotoxin in the food

questions.text: 1st pharyngeal arch gives rise to all except:

28-year-old man comes to the office due to abnormal movements of his arm and face over the last week. The patient has had 1- to 2-minute episodes of jerking and twitching of the left arm and left side of the faceThe patient was recently diagnosed with HIV and started antiretroviral therapy 2 months ago. At that time, his CD4 count was 46./mm3. Temperature is 37.8 C (100 F), blood pressure is 124/82 mm Hg, and pulse is 76/min. Left arm motor strength is 4/5, and deep tendon reflexes are 3+. An MRI of the brain is shown below. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for this patient?
Injury to the nerve that passes through structure marked A will result in?

options.label: A
options.text: Loss of taste sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue

options.label: B
options.text: Loss of taste sensation from posterior 1/3 tongue

options.label: C
options.text: Loss of general sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of taste sensation from posterior most part of tongue

questions.correct_answer: A. Loss of taste sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Loss of taste sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue

questions.text: During surgery on a 56-year-old man for a squamous cell carcinoma of the neck, the surgeon notices profuse bleeding from the deep cervical artery. Which of the following arteries must be ligated immediately to stop bleeding?
Human herpesvirus 8 is associated with all except?
The true statement about fetal circulation is:

options.label: A
options.text: Anatomical closure of foramen ovale is by 3 to 5 days

options.label: B
options.text: Anatomical closure of ductus venosus is by 3 to 7 days

options.label: C
options.text: Right umbilical vein gives rise to ligamentum teres

options.label: D
options.text: Functional closure of ductus arteriosus is by 2 to 3 days

questions.correct_answer: B. Anatomical closure of ductus venosus is by 3 to 7 days
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Anatomical closure of ductus venosus is by 3 to 7 days

questions.text: A 65-year-old woman comes to the emergency department due to 1 day of painful swelling of the left side of her face, associated with high fever and chills. She has had no facial trauma or injury to that area. Physical examination shows a warm, tender, erythematous rash with raised, well-demarcated borders on the left side of the face, including the left external ear. The ear canal has no discharge, and hearing is intact. Mild regional lymphadenopathy is present. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism of this patient's infection?

A patient presents with a unilateral throbbing headache, photophobia, and excessive lacrimation. He also complains of hemifacial pain on clenching of teeth. On examination, pupillary reflex, light reflex, and accommodation reflex are normal. Which of the following marked nerves is involved in the above scenario?
The structure marked A in the image below does not give rise to which of the following structures?

A 36-year-old man comes to the OPD due to 2 months of fatigue, intermittent arthralgias, and poor appetite. Liver aminotransferases are elevated. Hepatitis serology shows the following. Hepatitis A virus antibody, total: negative Hepatitis B surface antibody (HBsAb): negative Hepatitis B core antibody (HBcAb), total: positive Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg): positive Hepatitis B E antigen (HBeAg): positive Hepatitis C virus antibody: negative Which of the following genome replicative processes is most likely used by the virus infecting this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Double-stranded DNA → double-stranded DNA template → double-stranded DNA progeny

options.label: B
options.text: Double-stranded DNA → +RNA template → partially double-stranded DNA progeny

options.label: C
options.text: Single-stranded DNA → double-stranded DNA template → single-stranded DNA progeny

options.label: D
options.text: Single-stranded +RNA → double-stranded DNA template → single-stranded +RNA progeny

questions.correct_answer: B. Double-stranded DNA → +RNA template → partially double-stranded DNA progeny
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Double-stranded DNA → +RNA template → partially double-stranded DNA progeny.

questions.text: Organize the subsequent afferent columns in the floor of the fourth ventricle, proceeding from the medial to the lateral direction. General somatic General visceral Special somatic Special visceral

A 35-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a week of pain with swallowing and a substernal burning sensation. The patient was diagnosed with HIV 2 years ago. He was previously noncompliant with treatment but recently started taking antiretroviral therapy and trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole. CD4 count a month ago was 46/mm3.Examination of the oral cavity shows white plaques on the buccal mucosa and palate that are easily removable with a tongue scraper. The lungs are clear to auscultation. The abdomen is soft and nontender. What is the most appropriate next step in management of this patient's substernal chest pain?

options.label: B
options.text: Endoscopy with biopsy, cytology, and culture

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents to the trauma centre with a stab wound on the right side of the neck just lateral to the tip of the greater cornu of the hyoid bone. During the physical examination the patient was asked to protrude his tongue, which deviated to the right. Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Paralysis of the right genioglossus muscle permitted the left genioglossus to pull the tongue forward and turned the tip to the right side.

options.label: B
options.text: Genioglossus originates from the lower genial tubercles of the mandible

options.label: C
options.text: The hypoglossal nerve descends in the neck between the internal carotid artery and the internal jugular vein.

options.label: D
options.text: At about the level of the tip of the greater cornu of the hyoid bone the hypoglossal nerve turns forward and crosses the internal and external carotid arteries and the lingual artery to enter the tongue

questions.correct_answer: B. Genioglossus originates from the lower genial tubercles of the mandible
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Genioglossus originates from the lower genial tubercles of the mandible

questions.text: A 55-year-old male with poorly controlled diabetes presents with respiratory distress and copious nasal discharge since last 3 weeks. HRCT is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?
The life cycle given below is of which of the following:

Patient had difficulty in walking upstairs. When he was made to bear weight on right lower limb, the left-sided pelvis dropped down but when he was standing on the left lower limb, the right-sided pelvis moved up. Which of the following is the likely lesion?
questions.correct_answer: A. Right superior gluteal nerve palsy
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Right superior gluteal nerve palsy

questions.text: A 15-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department due to 18 hours of headache and lethargy. The headache began last night after she returned from a camping trip with her friends during which she had been healthy. The patient had fever and vomiting overnight, and this morning her family had difficulty waking her. Temperature is 39.6 C (103.3 F), blood pressure is 90/60 mm Hg, pulse is 120/min, and respirations are 22/min. The patient is obtunded and responds only to deep, painful stimuli. Physical examination shows resistance to passive neck flexion and several petechiae on the lower extremities. Cerebrospinal fluid test results are as follows: Glucose: 20 mg/dL Protein: 475 mg/dL TLC: 2000/mm3 Neutrophils: 90% Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?
Identify the papillae from the given histological section:

Identify the correct statements: Incubation period of LGV is 10-30days Mycobacterium indicus pranii (MIP) was indigenously developed in India for use in malaria. C.parvum is the most common coccidian parasite to be causing diarhhea in HIV/AIDS. Ganciclovir resistance is due to mutation in U797 phosphotransferase

A 64-year-old man comes to the OPD due to 2 days of dysuria, urinary frequency, and urgency. He recently underwent a cystoscopy for evaluation of hematuria. The patient has a history of hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and 30 pack-years of cigarette smoking. His temperature is 38.2 C (100.8 F). On examination, there is suprapubic tenderness on deep palpation but no costovertebral angle tenderness. Midstream urine culture grows gram-positive cocci in chains with growth > 100,000 colony-forming units/mL. The organism responsible for this patient's condition is most likely to demonstrate which of the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Growth only in absence of oxygen

questions.correct_answer: B. Gamma hemolysis on blood agar
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Gamma hemolysis on blood agar

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient presented with difficulty in foot eversion and sensory loss on the lateral leg & dorsum of foot. Which nerve lesion will lead to the following condition:

A 49-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a 3-week history of fever, weight loss, and anorexia. Both blood cultures grow Streptococcus gallolyticus. Echocardiogram reveals vegetations on the mitral valve. Other than antibiotic treatment, what additional step is recommended in this patient?

A 10-year-old boy was brought to the hospital with multiple fractures of the humerus secondary to a fall from height. On examination, there is difficulty in flexion of the elbow and supination of the forearm, and associated loss of sensation over the lateral aspect of the forearm. Which nerve is most likely to be injured?
Identify the organism?
Identify the true statements: Prevotella is a strict anaerobe Babesiosis may be seen in hepatocytes Interferon beta is raised in viral infections Affinity maturation is due to isotype switching
All the following form the marked structure except?

38-year-old man comes to the OPD due to 2 weeks of mildly pruritic and uncomfortable skin lesions. He first noticed a papule on his right index finger that soon ulcerated and began draining an odorless discharge. He then developed similar nodules on his right forearm. He works as a landscaper and recently began living with his girlfriend, who owns a cat. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's current condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Bacterial inoculation from a reservoir cat

options.label: C
options.text: Filarial larvae transmitted by mosquito bite

questions.correct_answer: B. Dimorphic fungus from decaying vegetation
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Dimorphic fungus from decaying vegetation

options.label: A
options.text: Between the internal oblique and external oblique

options.label: C
options.text: Between the internal oblique and rectus abdominis

options.label: D
options.text: Between the internal oblique and transversus abdominis

questions.correct_answer: D. Between the internal oblique and transversus abdominis
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Between the internal oblique and transversus abdominis

Two weeks ago, the patient went camping. Temperature is 38.3 C (101 F), blood pressure is 110/80 mm Hg, pulse is 88/min, and respirations are 16/min. The rash is shown in the image below. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

All of the following are true about grey rami communicantes except?

options.label: D
options.text: Present medial to white rami communicantes

questions.text: Which of the following is wrong regarding primary and secondary immune response?
The given life cycle belongs to which of the following organisms?

A 26-year-old woman comes to the emergency department due to a week of fever, chills, dyspnea on exertion, nonproductive cough, and fatigue. The patient has a history of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and was diagnosed with lupus nephritis by renal biopsy 4 months ago. She started taking cyclophosphamide and prednisone 40 mg daily, which have stabilized her renal function. Pulse oximetry is 86% on room air. The patient is using accessory muscles to breathe. No jugular venous distension is present. Cardiopulmonary examination shows bilateral crackles and normal heart sounds. Laboratory results are as follows Complete blood count Leukocytes: 12,400/mm³ Arterial blood gases pH: 7.48 PaO2: 60 mm Hg PaCO2: 29 mm Hg Lactate dehydrogenase: 340 U/L Chest x-ray reveals bilateral interstitial infiltrates. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's current condition?
Which is not a branch of the vessel known as the Anesthetist’s artery?
Which artery can be palpated by gently pressing your fingers between the medial malleolus and the calcaneal (Achilles) tendon?

Special electrodes are used to detect the change in membrane potential of a specific type of cardiac cell. These changes are recorded on the graph below. The deflection indicated by the arrow is most likely caused by movement of which of the following ions?

The blood oxygen saturations measured from different fetal vessel samples are 71%, 64%, 62%, 55%, and 43%. The sample with the greatest oxygen saturation was most likely obtained from which of the following blood vessels?

22-year-old student comes to the physician complaining of 4 days of fever, double vision, and painful swelling around his eyes. He also has significant muscle pain in his neck and jaw muscles. Two weeks ago the patient returned from a trip to Goa. One week after his return, he developed abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea . These symptoms resolved spontaneously. He has a history of intravenous drug abuse but recently completed a drug rehabilitation program. His temperature is 38.3 C (101 F), blood pressure is 110/70 mm Hg, pulse is 92/min, and respirations are 14/min. Physical examination shows subungual splinter hemorrhages, periorbital edema, and chemosis. Lungs are clear to auscultation. Cardiac examination shows no murmurs. The abdomen is soft and nontender without organomegaly. Laboratory results are as follows: Mean corpuscular volume: 13.0 g/dL Platelets: 228,000/mm³ Leukocytes: 10,500/mm³ Neutrophils: 56% Eosinophils: 22% Lymphocytes: 23% Creatine kinase: 220 U/L Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
The structure marked in the image is embedded in which of the following structures?

A 25-year-old patient presents with fever and weight loss. He gives a history of blood in the stools and vomiting 2 weeks ago. On examination, there is right hypochondriac tenderness and hepatomegaly. Abdominal CT a lesion in the right lobe of the liver with ragged edges, multiple septations, and eterogenous densities. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 25-year-old male went for trekking, came with a history of rash. Weil Felix test revealed elevated Ox 2 and Ox 19 titers. What is the most likely organism?
